timeline.message:
[#2267] Add AMQP 1.0 based DeviceConnectionClient implementation

Added transport protocol agnostic DeviceConnectionClient interface to
the adapter client module.
Added AMQP 1.0 based implementation which simply wraps the existing
vertx-proton based "legacy" DeviceConnectionClientImpl.

Signed-off-by: Kai Hudalla <kai.hudalla@bosch.io>

timeline.bodyText:
A few lines below, the exception text

Device Connection client factory is not set

should be replaced.
Regarding the isConnected() method in general:
It doesn't actually do what it proclaims in the javadoc anymore. The method is currently used in the MQTT adapter and in the registerReadinessChecks method of this class. I guess the invocation in the MQTT adapter isn't needed anymore (a missing connection will result in a failed future when using the respective clients anyway).
I think since it's then only invoked from registerReadinessChecks, isConnected() can be renamed and turned into a private method, or possibly inlined into registerReadinessChecks.
